subject: Climate & Environment
title: River Floods and Levees
description: A quick, practical guide to River Floods and Levees.

hook.text: The Mississippi River's 1927 flood submerged 70,000 square kilometers. It reshaped American policy.

buildup.text: River floods build slowly as weeks of rain raise water levels beyond a river's banks.

discovery.text: Levees and dams contain rivers â€” but they also give people false confidence to build in floodplains.

twist.text: When levees fail, the flood is worse than if they'd never existed. The water has nowhere to spread.

climax.text: The Netherlands lives below sea level thanks to engineered flood defenses â€” but even they plan for failure.

punchline.text: We can hold back a river. But the river always remembers where it used to go.

quiz.question: Why can levees make flooding worse when they fail?
options: Water has no room to spread gradually
Levees add extra water to the river
They cause earthquakes that trigger floods
